title: RBI Invites Public Comments on Draft Amendments for Net Open Position
content:
# RBI Invites Public Comments on Draft Amendments for Net Open Position

Ek important update hai! The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) ne recently **Draft Amendment Directions on Net Open Position (NOP) – Revised Instructions** ke liye public comments invite kiye hain. This is a significant move aiming to enhance the framework for foreign exchange risk management across various Regulated Entities (REs) in India.

Here’s a quick overview of what this means:

*   **What's New?** RBI ne Net Open Position (NOP) ke calculation aur foreign exchange risk par capital charge ke liye existing guidelines ko revise karne ka draft release kiya hai.
*   **Why the Change?** The main objective is to align domestic prudential norms with international Basel Committee on Banking Supervision (BCBS) standards and ensure consistent implementation across all regulated entities.
*   **Key Proposals:**
    *   The draft proposes to do away with separate offshore/onshore NOP calculations, leading to a unified measurement.
    *   It includes accumulated surplus of overseas operations in NOP calculation.
    *   Maintenance of foreign exchange risk capital charge on the actual NOP will be mandated.
    *   The "Shorthand method" for NOP calculation has been modified to treat open positions in gold separately.
    *   There's also a provision to exempt certain structural foreign exchange positions from NOP under specified conditions.
*   **Existing Guidelines:** The amendments modify instructions covered under the Master Direction - Risk Management and Inter-Bank Dealings (FMRD Master Direction No. 1/2016-17) and the Prudential Norms on Capital Adequacy Directions, 2025.
*   **Effective Date:** These revised directions are proposed to come into effect from **April 1, 2027**.
*   **Comment Deadline:** Interested parties can submit their comments on this draft until **February 3, 2026**.
